Yesterday was the sports equinox, a very special day in which all four major U.S. sports leagues (NBA, NHL, MLB, and NFL) were in action, plus Tiger and the Premier League.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/27/virgin-galactic-goes-public?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When You Wish Upon a Stock
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Richard Branson" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMTg3ODY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Virgin Galactic</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, many of you can fulfill your childhood dream of becoming an astronaut…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...'s extremely minor source of funding. Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic is set to become the first commercial space tourism company to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/24/virgin-galactic-set-to-trade-on-the-nyse-on-monday-as-the-first-space-tourism-stock.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go public</a>. It'll trade under the ticker "SPCE" on the New York Stock Exchange.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Forget the sappy "gazing at the stars" part, let's talk about the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-09/branson-s-virgin-galactic-space-business-to-go-public-wsj-says?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">financial engineering</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In July, venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya said his publicly listed firm Social Capital Hedosophia would take a 49% stake in Virgin Galactic. The deal won shareholder approval last Wednesday. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That merger allows Virgin Galactic to directly list shares and avoid costly underwriting fees. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The combined company is valued at roughly $1.5 billion. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"We are confident that VG is light-years ahead of the competition," Palihapitiya <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/07/09/virgin-galactic-announces-plans-become-first-publicly-listed-space-company/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's light-years ahead of something</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In August, Virgin Galactic opened <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/16/spaceport-america-looks-luxurious?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spaceport America</a>, its futuristic launch site in rural New Mexico. From there, it expects to send wealthy explorers to the edge of space, give them a glimpse of Earth’s curvature, and bring them home with an enviable amount of Insta ammo. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So far, the company's sold over <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/10/02/how-much-does-ticket-space-cost-meet-people-ready-fly/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">600 tickets</a> for about $250,000 apiece. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The extent of demand for Virgin Galactic's services will be a question mark. Space travel is expensive, complex, and dangerous. A Virgin test flight in 2014 crashed, killing a co-pilot and seriously injuring the other. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>There's also competition from space tourism ventures led by Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk, perhaps the two people you least want to compete with.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Virgin Galactic's listing is a big moment for space travel. But its sister brands are also making big moves here on Earth, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-27/fired-up-branson-prepares-for-biggest-test-as-space-shot-beckons?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes Bloomberg</a>. The airline Virgin Atlantic is expanding into India, Virgin Hotels is more than doubling its size, and the new Virgin Voyages cruise line will begin sea trials next year. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LUXURY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/27/lvmh-eyeing-tiffany-takeover?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
LVMH Gets Down on One Knee for Tiffany
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Louis Vuitton store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMTk0ODMyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The French luxury group behind brands like Louis Vuitton and Givenchy <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-26/lvmh-is-said-to-explore-takeover-of-tiffany-in-u-s-luxury-push?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">submitted</a> a takeover proposal to the NYC-based jeweler earlier this month, per multiple reports. It'd be LVMH's biggest-ever acquisition.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let's unwrap </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">LVMH is a $215 billion luxury powerhouse with a stake in everything from fashion to alcohol to hotels. Despite the trade war and turmoil in Hong Kong (which accounts for 6% of sales), things are as smooth as a Dom Pérignon Vintage 1961: LVMH <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2019/10/11/china-continues-put-retailers-spot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> a surprise 11% sales bump in Q3.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There's always room for improvement. </strong>Watches and jewelry is its slowest growing segment, and LVMH wants to boost its presence in the U.S., its second-largest market.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So about this $12B U.S. jeweler</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tiffany's been feeling less robin egg, more stormy blue. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It struggled to stay ahead of consumer trends, while tariffs with China and the Hong Kong protests have also </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tiffany-m-a-lvmh/french-luxury-group-lvmh-offers-to-buy-u-s-jeweler-tiffany-sources-idUSKBN1X50K2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">taken a bite</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And benefitting from a lower sales tax at home, Chinese customers are curbing their spending abroad. Tiffany is responding with more stores on mainland China.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Tiffany's reviewing the offer, but both companies are tight-lipped for now.</p>

UTILITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/27/california-experiences-historic-blackout?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
California Experiences Historic Blackout
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Power outages in California " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMTkwNjE3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Outage information from PG&E. Each pink bubble represents 5,000+ affected customers.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This a screenshot from <a href="http://critweb-outage.pgealerts.com/?WT.mc_id=Vanity_pge-outages&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">PG&E’s Outage Center</a> yesterday at noon, showing where power has been shut off across northern California. The utility has <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-27/pg-e-begins-shutting-off-power-to-more-than-2-5-million-people?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut power</a> to more than 2.5 million people in the largest blackout to prevent wildfires in California history. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The high winds that provoked the outages are expected to die down Monday, but <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/27/us/kincade-fire-california.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restoring power</a> could take a few more days after that.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, nearly 200,000 people were ordered to leave their homes as the Kincade Fire <a href="https://apnews.com/4d807d2a28b6410cbccda5e8291335c7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continues to burn</a> in northern California's wine country.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/27/google-upgrading-search-engine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Google Search Is Like a Toddler
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Google logo " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMTg5OTk3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It understands words and small phrases, but often thinks you want to take a train <em>from</em> O’Hare instead of <em>to</em> it. In the coming weeks, that’s going to change. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Friday, Google said it's rolling out the biggest <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/google-says-its-search-engine-will-better-understand-natural-speech-instead-of-just-keywords/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upgrade</a> to its search engine in years. It’s adding capabilities in natural language processing and machine learning (a subcategory of artificial intelligence) to help make sense of users’ questions and deliver the most relevant results. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The new software helps Google understand prepositional phrases, context, and small nuances in language. Ready for Kindergarten.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This matters because…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/search-language-understanding-bert/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">15% of daily queries</a> are ones Google hasn’t seen before. And tools like smart assistants are making conversational queries the norm. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Users, all you’ll notice is better search results. Businesses, there may be some changes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Google execs </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/10/25/google-is-making-big-change-its-vaunted-search-engine-you-might-not-notice/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> they don’t know if the upgrade applies to ad sales, which are pegged to search. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>There’s a <a href="https://www.motocms.com/blog/en/seo-statistics-local-industry-roi/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$70 billion</a> industry built around gaming the algorithm to land on Google’s front page. This change could make companies’ <a href="https://www.searchenginejournal.com/google-bert-update/332161/#close?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on-page SEO</a> (how they precisely use keywords) more important, according to experts. Because if you don’t make the front page, you’re SOL.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F27%2Fgoogle-upgrading-search-engine" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Ready+for+kindergarten+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/27/google-upgrading-search-engine&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F27%2Fgoogle-upgrading-search-engine&title=Google+Is+Upgrading+Its+Search+Engine+&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=Ready+for+kindergarten+" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY IMA® (INSTITUTE OF MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTANTS)
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">

<!--[if mso]>

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="IMA® (Institute of Management Accountants)" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/h4yItM4hEtsgfNKYq0/giphy.gif">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The most effective way to get a job you love is to be the best candidate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a simple truth, but we all know it’s easier said than done. That’s where the <a href="https://bs.serving-sys.com/Serving/adServer.bs?cn=trd&pli=1075083288&adid=1079503237&ord=[timestamp]" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CMA<sup class="sub-text">®</sup> (Certified Management Accountant</a>) comes in.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The CMA is recognized all over the world as the premier credential for finance and accounting professionals working in business.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Becoming CMA-certified means you’ll have mastered the 12 most crucial areas of management accounting. That means you’ll be turning information into insight and data into decisions, making you the most valued voice in the room. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A CMA is a step toward a higher earning potential and a seat at the leadership table.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://bs.serving-sys.com/Serving/adServer.bs?cn=trd&pli=1075083289&adid=1079503236&ord=[timestamp]" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Launch your new career trajectory today</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>

</th>
</tr>
</table>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/27/ads-push-advocacy-corporate-social-responsibility-world-series?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nats Broadcasts Become Political Battleground
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Trea Turner " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMjA3MTk1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Trautwig/MLB Photos via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Does watching the World Series feel a little too much like watching <em>Meet the Press</em>? Might be the commercials.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the first two games between the Nationals and the Astros, more ads were aired for advocacy and corporate social responsibility than any other ad category, per Advertising Analytics data cited by <a href="https://www.axios.com/advertisements-nationals-world-series-washington-1a5dca4d-b249-4f51-a216-6a1b13d9030d.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Axios's Sara Fischer</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Instead of "dilly dilly" beer ads, we're seeing dozens of spots from manufacturing conglomerate 3M (drilly drilly?). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Companies including Amazon, Microsoft, and IBM are pushing messages of economic growth and conservation. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More traditional sports advertisers—auto, entertainment, cable/phone/internet, and food & bev—rounded out the top five ad categories. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why this is happening: </strong>Well, even the D.C. elite like baseball teams (it polls well). And the team they're most likely to root for—and watch on TV—is the Nats. "This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for brands to reach Washington decision makers in a casual environment," Fischer writes.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Strong contender for the most packed week of 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>International trade in goods and services; Bill Gates turns 64; earnings (Alphabet, AT&T, Walgreens Boots Alliance, Spotify, Beyond Meat) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Fed meeting starts; National Cat Day; new <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/business-casual-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Business Casual</em></a> episode; earnings (Pfizer, Merck, BP, GM, Shopify, MasterCard, AMD, Electronic Arts, Grubhub)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Fed announcement; Q3 GDP; Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg testifies in D.C. before House lawmakers; potential Game 7 of World Series; earnings (GE, Lyft, Etsy, Sony, Facebook, Apple, Starbucks, Yum Brands) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Halloween; Brexit deadline; earnings (Altria, Pinterest, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Sanofi, Royal Dutch Shell, Estee Lauder, Kraft Heinz) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>First day of November; Apple TV Plus launch; jobs report; earnings (Berkshire Hathaway, Alibaba, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, AIG); “I said <em>what </em>at last night’s Halloween party?” Day</p>

670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMTg3ODY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eVirgin Galactic\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, many of you can fulfill your childhood dream of becoming an astronaut…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...'s extremely minor source of funding. Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic is set to become the first commercial space tourism company to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/24/virgin-galactic-set-to-trade-on-the-nyse-on-monday-as-the-first-space-tourism-stock.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ego public\u003c/a\u003e. It'll trade under the ticker \"SPCE\" on the New York Stock Exchange.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eForget the sappy \"gazing at the stars\" part, let's talk about the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-09/branson-s-virgin-galactic-space-business-to-go-public-wsj-says?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinancial engineering\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn July, venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya said his publicly listed firm Social Capital Hedosophia would take a 49% stake in Virgin Galactic. The deal won shareholder approval last Wednesday. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat merger allows Virgin Galactic to directly list shares and avoid costly underwriting fees. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe combined company is valued at roughly $1.5 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"We are confident that VG is light-years ahead of the competition,\" Palihapitiya \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/07/09/virgin-galactic-announces-plans-become-first-publicly-listed-space-company/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt's light-years ahead of something\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn August, Virgin Galactic opened \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/16/spaceport-america-looks-luxurious?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSpaceport America\u003c/a\u003e, its futuristic launch site in rural New Mexico. From there, it expects to send wealthy explorers to the edge of space, give them a glimpse of Earth’s curvature, and bring them home with an enviable amount of Insta ammo. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo far, the company's sold over \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/10/02/how-much-does-ticket-space-cost-meet-people-ready-fly/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e600 tickets\u003c/a\u003e for about $250,000 apiece. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe extent of demand for Virgin Galactic's services will be a question mark. Space travel is expensive, complex, and dangerous. A Virgin test flight in 2014 crashed, killing a co-pilot and seriously injuring the other. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere's also competition from space tourism ventures led by Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk, perhaps the two people you least want to compete with.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eVirgin Galactic's listing is a big moment for space travel. But its sister brands are also making big moves here on Earth, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-27/fired-up-branson-prepares-for-biggest-test-as-space-shot-beckons?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e. The airline Virgin Atlantic is expanding into India, Virgin Hotels is more than doubling its size, and the new Virgin Voyages cruise line will begin sea trials next year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe French luxury group behind brands like Louis Vuitton and Givenchy \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-26/lvmh-is-said-to-explore-takeover-of-tiffany-in-u-s-luxury-push?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" It'd be LVMH's biggest-ever acquisition.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet's unwrap \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLVMH is a $215 billion luxury powerhouse with a stake in everything from fashion to alcohol to hotels. Despite the trade war and turmoil in Hong Kong (which accounts for 6% of sales), things are as smooth as a Dom Pérignon Vintage 1961: LVMH \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2019/10/11/china-continues-put-retailers-spot?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere's always room for improvement. \u003c/strong\u003eWatches and jewelry is its slowest growing segment, and LVMH wants to boost its presence in the U.S., its second-largest market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo about this $12B U.S. jeweler\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTiffany's been feeling less robin egg, more stormy blue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt struggled to stay ahead of consumer trends, while tariffs with China and the Hong Kong protests have also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tiffany-m-a-lvmh/french-luxury-group-lvmh-offers-to-buy-u-s-jeweler-tiffany-sources-idUSKBN1X50K2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" bite\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd benefitting from a lower width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyMTg5OTk3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt understands words and small phrases, but often thinks you want to take a train \u003cem\u003efrom\u003c/em\u003e O’Hare instead of \u003cem\u003eto\u003c/em\u003e it. In the coming weeks, that’s going to change. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Friday, Google said it's rolling out the biggest \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/google-says-its-search-engine-will-better-understand-natural-speech-instead-of-just-keywords/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupgrade\u003c/a\u003e to its search engine in years. It’s adding capabilities in natural language processing and machine learning (a subcategory of artificial intelligence) to help make sense of users’ questions and deliver the most relevant results. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe new software helps Google understand prepositional phrases, context, and small nuances in language. Ready for Kindergarten.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis matters because…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.blog.google/products/search/search-language-understanding-bert/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e15% of daily queries\u003c/a\u003e are ones Google hasn’t seen before. And tools like smart assistants are making conversational queries the norm. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUsers, all you’ll notice is better search results. Businesses, there may be some changes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eGoogle execs \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/10/25/google-is-making-big-change-its-vaunted-search-engine-you-might-not-notice/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e they don’t know if the upgrade applies to ad sales, which are pegged to search. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThere’s a \u003ca href=\"https://www.motocms.com/blog/en/seo-statistics-local-industry-roi/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$70 billion\u003c/a\u003e industry built around gaming the algorithm to land on Google’s front page. This change could make companies’ \u003ca href=\"https://www.searchenginejournal.com/google-bert-update/332161/#close?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon-page SEO\u003c/a\u003e (how they precisely use keywords) more important, according to experts. Because if you don’t make the front page, you’re SOL.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDoes watching the World Series feel a little too much like watching \u003cem\u003eMeet the Press\u003c/em\u003e? Might be the commercials.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the first two games between the Nationals and the Astros, more ads were aired for advocacy and corporate social responsibility than any other ad category, per Advertising Analytics data cited by \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/advertisements-nationals-world-series-washington-1a5dca4d-b249-4f51-a216-6a1b13d9030d.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAxios's Sara Fischer\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInstead of \"dilly dilly\" beer ads, we're seeing dozens of spots from manufacturing conglomerate 3M (drilly drilly?). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCompanies including Amazon, Microsoft, and IBM are pushing messages of economic growth and conservation. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMore traditional sports advertisers—auto, entertainment, cable/phone/internet, and food \u0026 bev—rounded out the top five ad categories. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy this is happening: \u003c/strong\u003eWell, even the D.C. elite like baseball teams (it polls well). And the team they're most likely to root for—and watch on TV—is the Nats. \"This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for brands to reach Washington decision makers in a casual environment,\" Fischer
